values: I'm baking marble cheesecake brownies for a bake sale, and I'm not going to Iron and Wine tonight. Though I'd love to have seen them, and I actually planned to, the entire process of actually doing so seems very laborious. And right now, the mess of twigs bouncing outside the window holds as much beauty as I could ever want. Not that the branches themselves are so beautiful and not to say all of the beauty belongs to these branches, but rather there is a Great Beauty they remind me of because of where their beauty finds its Source. Maybe in serving as a reminder they give me hope for that Beauty. Sometimes they're just branches. Sometimes it's given to me that I should witness them as I do now. The beauty neither comes from my own eyes nor from the branches solely, but is a combination of circumstances, and regardless of what one determines "circumstance" (or "Circumstance") to mean, this whole scenario has little to do with me. Sometimes I feel sad and lonely 'cause I've prepared myself to recieve sad and lonely, but sometimes even if I'm prepared for them it's like they aren't there. Sometimes I've prepared myself to recieve joy and beauty to a small extent, and when either are around, however rarely that might be, their experience far exceeds any experience of happiness, fun, excitement, leisure, pleasure that I go out and take for myself. Sometimes it turns out that pleasure is a very painful thing. I'm grateful for my small capacity to recieve, and my wonder at what can be recieved is inexpressible. Tonight, I'm fine at home, and I think I'll stay here.
I had a good night tonight. I played a show with Andrew then I ate and then I danced. I'm pretty sure that sums it up. And I'm glad for friends. I'mma sleep.
For all the hum and buzz a computer may make it doesn't well compare to a human voice, eye contact, or a warm hand. Maybe now I can sleep. Goodnight someone.

So I'm back in Tucson again. I expect I'll be staying for a while now. I was supposed to wait 'til Wednesday to come back but I was too miserable to stay longer and now I'm home in an empty house, which doesn't fix the part about feeling alone but at least I don't have to do hard work when I don't even want to move.

Love, Adam
Carl Johnson and myself are playing at the open mic at epic cafe on Thursday at 8:30. So people should totally come. It's on 4th and University. P.S. link

I don't know if anyone checks this anymore but I feel like doing stuff here.

My whole past has become very very distant. I really can remember far less than I was able to six months ago. It's sort of nice having shifted my focus to nothing but the present (as often as I can I focus on nothing else, at least). Of course, anxiety still seems to be wringing out the contents of my stomach on a daily basis anyway, but at least I can fight it.

Last Saturday we did a three-year memorial service for my friend Kyle with just my mother, my brother Joel, and I, with my father leading the service, and my mother. It was such a pretty service, and sorrowful. Then on Wednesday I went and visited Kyle's grave in Twin Falls, ID with my parents. Ever since I visited the monastery things have been a lot clearer. And I'm doing far less to distract myself now.

I got dropped off, then I played guitar without two strings, then I went and got coffee and saw a cute girl who I didn't talk to, and then I went and bought the latest Gomez album.

So far it's good.

Were I someone else, I'm pretty sure I'd think that Adam kid to be far better at being alone than he is.

Who'd have thunk?
I got rid of my cell phone. My house number is 326-5171
P.S. Thursday night, 8:30, Epic Cafe, Adam Nixon, guitar, mic, you.

Politics people focus a lot of attention on the honesty and consistency of politicians, who are widely known to be dishonest and inconsistent. I don't understand why anyone even bothers to make a point of it, but somehow it's one of the most prevalent subjects in news and conversation and such.
You hafta guess which one is me. Done for now.

So I'm back in Tucson since Wednesday and I have an apartment over near Speedway & Country Club, and I have a cell phone. The number is 304-7832, so call me if you aren't being mean.

Love to all and all that business.
So I'm back in Tucson. That's right, I said it. Being a counselor was pretty awesome. I had fun. I'm tired though. Plus I got sick on the way back to Tucson. wooooooo
Bad stuff is gonna happen and I'm sorry. I got a DUI that tuesday night.
So I'm out until August 19th or so. Just so you know that I'm not dead. Love and such, bye.
You get to guess who isn't gonna be here from sometime in the next couple days to August 19th. Hint: this person is going to be a counselor in Pennsylvania, and this person is not someone else.
They told me there was no need to be sorry and I didn't understand. There's always a need to be sorry. Especially for me. I owe something to everyone.
So Jonas just IMed me from LA and told me he couldn't talk 'cause he had to go watch the Lakers live. I thought that was funny. bye.

So I had fun last night and didn't get home early but I still got up early enough to go get certified for cpr and first aid (which I need to leave for soon) and tonight I'm invited to both all-night skating and a party over here on the east side, and it sounds fun but I don't want to ditch my friends but I wanna get to know these other kids better and the all-night skating poses a problem because I wanna be able to go to church tomorrow for the sake of my parents and I need to leave for my class right now but I'm getting butterflies in my stomach just thinking about leaving the house to do something like this.

bye
I need a girlfriend or something. Pathetic? Livejournal? Yes? Yes?
So I got distracted by this site for a few hours.

big_nixon is toxic! Dangerously addictive.
T
Toxic

Username:

So I noticed that my last two entries started with "so," like I'm continuing a conversation? I dunno.

Anyways, so I get home at 4:00AM this morning after a wonderful time at the Cretcher residence. I get to sleep around 4:30. Some point in the morning, beginning to reach consciousness in my bowl chair thingy, I feel a tickle on my arm, and, due to the location of the tickle, I begin to wonder if my eyelashes are rubbing against my arm. I test my theory by moving my head a little, but the tickle seems inconsistent with my own movement. I open my eyes, and there's this big ol' shiny black spider on my arm, and its legs are extra pointy like tiny daggers, and half a second later I'm on the other side of the room and the spider is gone. Damn I can get up fast when I'm freaked out. I still don't know where the spider is, though.

So I graduated and stuff. I missed the last week of school anyway, so I dunno. I've been done, more or less, for a while now.

Fun times.
So I'm back from Pittsburgh. Starting yesterday.
I've decided that today was a bit of a trip, considering it was my last day of school, aside from the two finals I have to make up for the one day I'm back. I'm gonna have lots of fun in Pittsburgh.

I can't wait to be in Pittsburgh for my brother's wedding. only two days of school 'til then. I have to reschedule my finals around it, but it's gonna be lots of fun, and I'll get to see people every day I'm there. I'll be back on the 19th.
Oh man. My friend found the funniest thing. oh my Try to guess what "fufme" stands for first.

So I'm sick again with the same exact thing as last time. That one would have lasted for a week, but I overdid things on the weekend following. If this one lasts a week, I'll have two school days to get caught up before I leave for my brother's wedding. I might just have to go to school. I went today and felt miserable the entire time. Headache, fever, and bad sore throat. Damn.

Every time I sleep I end up in that state between sleep and wakefulness where you're still able to dream, but you're conscious for the most part. I have the worst dreams, though, and they make me toss and turn the entire time. And they don't change, either. They're in the same place and the same situation and it seems to be following some storyline but it's driving me crazy 'cause they're such bad dreams.

Bleck.

Friday sucked, but last night was way fun. I liked hanging out with new friends. I was gonna go to coffee with another new friend today, but now I'm not. Aside from that, I'm sick. I have a sore throat and I'm achy and I can feel my eyes hot on my eyelids. And my skin is extra-sensitive in that weird sick person way. Thanks for hanging out last night.

This class is make us stupider. Watch man fall off motorcycle. Kyle shine mouse laser in eye. ugh ugh

No, but seriously, Kyle just shined his optical mouse laser in his own eye. This class kills.
I totally forgot about those concerts on Friday! Crap.
omg omg! omg!
Flashback! I'm ok now.

So I wore my batman shirt with the velcro cape to school today and I was walking around and this mexican guy was like, "that guy in the batman shirt is so cool," all loud and things, and, pretending to be as stupid as him, I say "Who, me?" He responds: "No, the other guy in the batman shirt."

"Ok"

And I left. He called me a fag, too. I'm thinking of dressing especially unreasonably tomorrow. I've got these slick black pants, and plenty of too-small shirts. And Stephanie's platforms.

I think I'm tired. I get the weirdest feelings, and it's only been happening this year, but I can just be hanging out or something, and I'll suddenly feel really sad, and then I'll think of how funny it is that I'm feeling sad, and I'll start laughing. or I'll almost cry out of nowhere. or I'll just laugh. I feel sorta crazy when that happens. I want to hang out with my cousin. I'm sure he genuinely wants me around. and we get along really well. I don't like wondering.
Today was pretty lonely. So I stayed up extra late? Whatever. Goodnight.

So my former Cisco (computer networking) class has taken a bit of a turn, and now, instead of learning how to network computers, I'm learning how to play midi files such as lowrider and adding my own sounds, with the help of various soundboards across the internet. My most recent work involved a midi of "my sharona" and a bill lumbergh of office space soundboard. Expect to see it on shelves sometime soon. It's hot.

I liked this place I just went to. I sat and listened and watched and had tea. it was perfect just having company there. and then I took the long drive home and got out to the lonely streets so I could listen to my best favorite band on my headphones. and drove sorta fast. then no gas pedal on my street. i should go there more often, with or without a friend. I should talk to the biker guys. but the drive down my street was sort of surreal. it was good.

I lack certain capacities, such as those for planning, memory, and interpretation of others. I'm better than most people at some things, but I don't see the value in that now. Bleck. I can't wait 'til California. August. mmm

So last night I went to Main Street and did karaoke. I was pretty sober by my turn to sing, and I sang Come On Eileen (poorly, I thought) but everyone seemed to like it. I took my little boy coat off in the process, and sort of spazzed. Then some guy came up to me and asked me if I got laid all the time. Due to my response, his friend lost a bet. I can't wait to perform with my band.

Fun Spring Break so far.

Church at 11 tonight. 'til 2 in the morning or something. I'm somehow looking forward to it. I think I want to sing. I'll sing.
I keep staying up really late just so I'll sleep through my next day, but it doesn't work, and I just end up being awake more. lame
Ladies and Gentlemen tonight at 8:00 at Spring Fling! Be there or something. I know I will.

It's late. It's Spring Break, I guess. I'm looking forward to Ladies and Gentlemen tomorrow night. I'm obviously very enthusiastic about things and not tired tonight. Oh yeah, and this isn't directed toward anyone; I just thought it was sorta funny.
